SenderStatisticsByTagNameAndBatchID.summary: Retrieve Sending Data under Specified Conditions
SenderStatisticsByTagNameAndBatchID.title: Retrieve Sending Data under Specified Conditions

schema.description: Sending address. Not filled in represents all addresses.
The recipient address. If you leave this parameter empty, all recipient addresses are included.
The delivery status. If you leave this parameter empty, all states are included. Valid values: 0: successful, 2 invalid email address, 3: spam, and 4: failed.
The start time. The start time can be up to 30 days earlier than the current time. Format: yyyy-MM-dd.
The end time. The difference between the start time and the end time cannot exceed 30 days. Format: yyyy-MM-dd.
The email tag. If you leave this parameter empty, all email tags are included.
The number of entries to return in the request. Valid values: 1 to 100.
The start position of the next page. The offset for the request. If you want to obtain more records, specify the return value of the NextStart parameter for this parameter.

NextStart.description: The start position of the next page. The return value of the NextStart parameter indicates the start position of the next page. If you want to obtain more records, specify the return value in the next request.

Status.description: The delivery status. Valid values: 0: successful, 2 invalid email address, 3: spam, and 4: failed.

UtcLastUpdateTime.description: The most recent update time (timestamp format)

ErrorClassification.description:
Detailed classification of error causes:

- SendOk
- SmtpNxBox

etc.

404.errorMessage: The specified mail address is not found.

schema.description: The ID of the domain name.

DomainStatus.description:
The status of the domain name. Indicates whether the domain name is verified and available.

*   0: indicates that the domain name is verified and available.
*   1: indicates that the domain name fails to be verified and is unavailable.
*   2: indicates that the domain name is available, but not filed or configured with a CNAME record.
*   3: indicates that the domain name is available but not filed.
*   4: indicates that the domain name is available but not configured with a CNAME record.

schema.description: The ID of the domain name.
Determine whether to perform real-time DNS resolution

IcpStatus.description: Filing status. 1 indicates that it has been filed, and 0 indicates that it has not been filed.

DnsTxt.description: TXT record value resolved through public DNS.

DomainId.description: The ID of the domain name.

DnsSpf.description: SPF record value resolved through public DNS

DnsMx.description: MX record value resolved through public DNS

DomainStatus.description:
The status of the domain name. Indicates whether the domain name is verified and available. Valid values:

0: indicates that the domain name is verified and available.

1: indicates that the domain name fails to be verified and is unavailable.

2: indicates that the domain name is available, but not filed or configured with a CNAME record.

3: indicates that the domain name is available but not filed.

4: indicates that the domain name is available but not configured with a CNAME record.

TracefRecord.description: The CNAME verification record provided by the Direct Mail console.

DomainType.description: TXT records provided by the Direct Mail console.

DnsDmarc.description: dmarc record value resolved through public DNS
